quest.name: Sounding Out the Amphitheatre
journal: Alphinaud seems intent on traveling to the Akh Afah Amphitheatre.

Upon learning that the Akh Afah Amphitheatre may yet harbor your quarry, Alphinaud suggests employing the swiftest means of travel available─the aetheryte found within the Warrens of Snowcloak. Speak with the House Durendaire guard stationed at the tunnel entrance in the western highlands.

You enter the Akh Afah Amphitheatre, and soon cross paths with its heretical occupants. Though Alphinaud declares his intention to parley, the heretics are not inclined to trust his word, and the encounter quickly devolves into violence─an unwanted conflict from which you and your fellows emerge triumphant yet frustrated. With naught save the parting words of the retreating heretics on which to rely, you have little choice but to investigate the island known as the Dreaming Dragon. Speak with Estinien at the entrance to the Warrens, and plan the next step of your journey.

Before making for the Dreaming Dragon, Estinien suggests that you visit a group of dragonslayers known as the Convictors who have pitched camp in the region of Twinpools. Speak with the Convictors' leader, Jantellot, and learn what he knows of the heretics and their island lair.

Your meeting with the honored leader of the Convictors serves to convince you of two things: first, that Jantellot is ignorant of Iceheart's movements, and second, that he is only marginally better informed about those of his own men. After freely admitting that his fellow dragonslayers often fail to share information with him, he invites you to question them yourselves.
objectives: Speak with Jantellot at the Convictors' camp.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Akh Afah Amphitheatre... The very place where you witnessed the manifestation of the primal Shiva, was it not?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: If that is our destination, the journey will be long indeed. The amphitheatre lies on the other side of a treacherous tract of ice and snow that cannot swiftly be crossed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then we must place our faith in the Aethernet. As you may recall, our dear friend Moenbryda succeeded in recreating the Akh Afah beacon after it had been destroyed by Lady Iceheart. At the time, it was assumed that the resultant aetheryte would only be temporarily viable, but given that the heretics of Gorgagne Mills seem to have been in regular contact with their brethren at the amphitheatre, I'll wager it still functions. I suggest we make for the aetheryte within Snowcloak without delay.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Correct me if I am wrong, Estinien, but in the course of mapping the Snowcloak tunnel system, a passage was discovered leading out into the western highlands, was it not? Might it be possible for us to reach the aetheryte from this side of the wall?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It should. House Durendaire posted soldiers at the western highlands entrance after the tunnels were cleared, but they will not deny us entry.

dialogue.name: KIGHTLEADER01605
dialogue.text: There are requests for foodstuffs, clothing, and all manner of provisions. Iceheart's followers must yet inhabit the ruins we had thought abandoned...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: “Akh Afah” is taken from the dragons' tongue─it means, roughly, “Eternal Circle.” 'Tis little wonder the heretics thought to return to the place.

dialogue.name: KIGHTLEADER01605
dialogue.text: Do you mean to follow the heretics' trail, then? I will see that Ser Redwald is informed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Do you recall the first time you ventured into these tunnels in search of Lady Iceheart? It seems an age ago, does it not...? Back then, I still believed myself the commander of the Crystal Braves...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: What ails our young lord? The moment we arrived at the wall, his face took on an ashen pallor. Does he fear facing the heretics within their own lair?

dialogue.name: TRISTECHAMBEL
dialogue.text: Ah, the guests of House Fortemps...accompanied by the Azure Dragoon, no less!

dialogue.name: TRISTECHAMBEL
dialogue.text: I cannot imagine what brought you out this far, but you are welcome to enter the tunnels if that is your will.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Assuming the Akh Afah beacon still functions─and we must pray to the Twelve it does─we shall arrive at our destination in mere moments.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though I do not expect to be greeted by the primal Shiva, we should nevertheless be prepared for a frosty reception. ...The heretics are not like to rejoice at the appearance of uninvited guests─particularly ones with our history.

dialogue.name: ADELPHEL
dialogue.text: We have begun surveying the Warrens from the western entrance, but progress is slow. 'Twould seem not all the rats have left the nest...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: An impressive structure. I wonder how many ages it has endured...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Mayhap you should ask its occupants. They seem a friendly bunch.

dialogue.name: HERETIC01606
dialogue.text: Dogs of Ishgard! Is it not enough that you banish our beloved saint? Will you not be satisfied until the ice is slick with the last drops of our blood!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Stay your weapons! We come under the flag of parley! We wish only to speak with your mistress, that we might broker a peace!

dialogue.name: HERETIC01606
dialogue.text: Do you think us fools, boy!? It will take more than honeyed words to earn our trust. You walk with the dragonslayer, and we know all too well what he is capable of!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: My reputation precedes me...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...They give us little choice.

dialogue.name: HERETIC01606
dialogue.text: Come, brothers! May dragon wings bear us to victory!

dialogue.name: HERETIC01606
dialogue.text: <gasp> Th-They fight like demons... 'Tis death to remain!

dialogue.name: HERETIC01606
dialogue.text: Fall back, brothers! Retreat to the Cinders!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I see no sign of Lady Iceheart. Would that we could have questioned one of them...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: What would you ask that we do not already know? They make for the Cinders, and so must we. Even should an ambush await us, 'tis certain there will be more heretics to question.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: “The Cinders,” you say? I confess, the name is unknown to me. Mayhap you would be so good as to enlighten us, Estinien?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...I suspect it is the heretics' way of referring to the Dreaming Dragon─an island of sorts found in the midst of the frozen lake of Ashpool.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Some five hundred years past, 'tis told that the Azure Dragoon of the age fought a dragon of titanic proportions. After a savage struggle, the mighty creature was weakened unto the point of death, and forced into a magicked slumber by an entire chapter of the Holy See's sorcerers.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Ere long, a rain of ash and cinders did begin to fall upon the sleeping serpent's motionless form, covering the creature at length in a shroud of grey. ...Of course, a thick layer of ice has since formed on top of it, but you may be sure I speak true.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A fascinating tale. We should make haste to this ashen isle.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Only in a land where war has raged for a thousand years could enough ash fall to bury a dragon the size of an island...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The Dreaming Dragon lies far to the west. Before we approach the frozen beast, however, there is another place I would visit first.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I am told the Convictors have set up camp in Twinpools. Their leader, Jantellot, may have information of use to us.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Ah, but mayhap you are not familiar with that name, either... The Convictors are dragonslayers─after a fashion─but I am willing to wager that they encounter their fair share of heretics. If we are indeed walking into a trap, I would learn all there is to know of our foe.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A sound suggestion. Let us speak with these Convictors, then, and temper our haste with a measure of caution.

dialogue.name: ADELPHEL
dialogue.text: My thanks for ridding the tunnels of their rat infestation. With any luck, I shall finally be able to carry out my work uninterrupted.

dialogue.name: TRISTECHAMBEL
dialogue.text: What...? You've driven off the heretics? That should certainly ease the minds of our surveyors!

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: Well, well. What do we have here? Hoping to join the esteemed ranks of the Convictors, are we?

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: The hard-eyed lasslad looks promising, but you have a frail look about you, boy... I give you three days ere the wilds claim your corpse.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I beg your pardon...?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Be not so quick to judge. I have seen this “frail” youth fell heretics with a flick of his wrist.

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: And who are you to question my─ By the Fury!

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: That armor... That lance! The Azure Dragoon himself graces our camp!

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: Pray forgive my disrespect, ser. I am Jantellot─leader of the Convictors and fellow slayer of dragons.

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: ...May I ask what winds─fair or foul─carry you into our humble camp?

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: Ah. Lady Iceheart, is it? Aye, I know her by reputation─but I'm afraid I've seen naught of her or her people.

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: That said, my own men can be...ahem...somewhat lax when it comes to making reports. You may wish to question them yourselves.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you. We shall.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, Estinien─let us make our way through the camp, and see what information there is to be had.

dialogue.name: LANCER01607
dialogue.text: Ah, 'tis colder than Lady Iceheart's frost-rimed...uh, soul! Greetings, miladymilord! A fine day, is it not?

dialogue.name: ARCHER01607
dialogue.text: Be still! How am I supposed to watch for the distant flicker of dragon wings when my ears are ringing with your incessant chatter!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the heretics!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You will not defile this sacred place a second time!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: N-No! Wait! We did not come here to fight!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Waste no more words on them. They are deaf to reason.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: By the Fury... They partake of the blood of dragons!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Seven hells... Can dragon blood truly bring about such a transformation?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You should not have come here, Ishgardians...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Twelve forfend!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: At last, a foe I might sink my lance into.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You are fortunate indeed. Behold the true power of our faith!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No... Our journey has scarce begun...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I cannot fall to this rabble...

obj.n: For All the Nights to Come
